common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported issues with the Pieces Desktop application for both Windows and macOS, including a non-dismissable overlay message on Windows and problems with conversation titles saving too early on macOS. The Pieces team acknowledged these issues, requested additional information for debugging, and is actively working on solutions and patches.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues launching the Pieces Windows Desktop version.

**Problems Identified:**

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requests additional information:
    * Windows version
    * Confirmation of PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop installation

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue acknowledged and under investigation.
* Awaiting additional information from ThemePark. 

**Additional Notes:**

* Related issues identified for reference:
    * Unable to open Pieces Core Services
    * Pieces For Desktop App no longer opens after latest Pieces OS 11.0 Release
    * Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version

* Helpful resources provided:

related_issues.title: extension Raycast is outdated
related_issues.text:
extension Raycast is outdated
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS Version: 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I frequently use Raycast, a macOS utility similar to Spotlight. However, I’ve encountered an issue where Raycast cannot detect or establish a connection with Pieces OS. Instead of linking to Pieces OS, it suggests downloading the application again, even though it is already installed.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @dncwarren raised a problem with an issue in the Pieces extension for Raycast.

**Problems identified:**

* The extension was not working properly.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @claire-at-pieces pushed a hotfix for the issue.
* The hotfix was approved and new version `0.1.0` was released.

**Current status/outcome:**

* @claire-at-pieces confirmed that the patch was accepted and the latest version is now working.
* @dncwarren was notified and encouraged to report any further issues. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place in January 2025. 
* The conversation highlights good communication between the developer and the user.

recommendations: **Prioritize Desktop Application Issues:** Allocate additional resources to address the bugs and user experience issues reported in the Pieces Desktop application for both Windows and macOS.
**Improve Overlay Message Handling:** Investigate and resolve the non-dismissable overlay message bug on Windows, ensuring users can easily dismiss messages and understand their meaning.
**Review Conversation Title Saving Logic:** Address the issue of conversation titles saving prematurely on macOS, potentially by implementing a more user-friendly save mechanism.
**Monitor Raycast Extension Stability:** While the Raycast extension issue was resolved, continue monitoring its stability and address any new issues promptly to ensure a seamless integration.

**Gather Detailed System Information:** When users report bugs, request comprehensive system information (OS version, Pieces OS version, application logs) to facilitate faster debugging and resolution.
**Proactive Communication:** Keep users informed about the status of reported issues, especially for high-impact bugs like the non-dismissable overlay message.
**Consider User Feedback Mechanisms:** Explore implementing in-app feedback mechanisms or surveys to gather more detailed insights into user experience and identify potential areas for improvement.
